_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Lineage - Riverside Building #3 Facility has a long standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system.  



Lineage - Riverside Building #3 Facility's senior management is not only committed to offer superior service, but to also maintain a Risk Management Program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities.  It is also policy to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substance.





STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED



Lineage - Riverside Building #3 Facility is located at 2356 Fleetwood Drive, Jurupa Valley. California 92509.  The area immediately surrounding the facility is a mixture of mostly urban and some rural areas. 

The regulated substance managed at the facility is anhydrous ammonia. The facility's primary activities revolve around large-scale public storage of food products.





ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFICATIONS STEPS



As part of the implementation of this CalARP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Lineage - Riverside Building #3 Facility to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia.  Furthermore, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed. 



The regulated substance is over the 500-lbs. state threshold for CalARP Program and the 10,000-lbs. federal threshold for EPA RMP and Cal-OSHA PSM.  As a result, the anhydrous ammonia covered process (ammonia refrigeration system) is subject to CalARP/RMP Program Level 3 and CalOSHA-PSM.



Program 3 Prevention Program Elements include:



?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training

?    Mechanical Integrity

?    Management Of Change

?    Pre-Start Safety Review

?    Compliance Audit

?    Incident Investigation

?    Employee Participation

?    Hot Work Permit

?    Contractors



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Lineage - Riverside Building #3 Facility has had no releases in the last five years (April 2011 - April 2016) that meets the five-year accident history reporting criteria, therefore no data is required. 





EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



In addition, Lineage - Riverside Building #3 Facility has an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in place to properly prepare for emergency evacuations, to provide first aid and medical treatment and to contact federal, state and local officials in the event of a major release of ammonia.  The Facility Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the local responding units, County of Riverside, Environmental Health, HAZMAT Team and local Fire Department.  A current copy of the EAP and Crisis Management Plan, that includes ammonia responses, can be found with the General and Maintenance Managers.



In addition, the Facility has submitted a Hazardous Material Business Plan via County of Riverside Department of Environmental Health, Hazardous Material Business Plan Electronic Submittal Portal on 12/8/2015.





PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Several studies have been conducted to examine mitigation measures to improve safety at the facility.  These studies include:

?A Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) was performed in March 15/16, 2016.

?A Hazard Assessment, performed in April 2016.

?A Seismic Assessment was performed on March 2016.

?A Compliance Audit was performed on March 14-17 2016. 



Any outstanding recommendations from these studies and the target completion date or closure have been provided within each individual report.
